Our veterans are our heroes. Without their service and sacrifice, we would not be the greatest nation in the history of the world. Because of our veterans, we are able to enjoy our Freedoms as Americans. They deserve our respect and recognition.

If you are a veteran or have a veteran in your family who is attempting to receive medals, decorations, or benefits earned through military service, please call our Taylorville office at 217-824-5117 or visit our website at http://RodneyDavis.house.gov. We are more than happy to help.

Ahead of Mr. Stein‚Äôs 97th birthday last month, his family was attempting to obtain a POW medal he had not received for his military service as a birthday gift. Our office worked with the NPRC to connect Mr. Stein with the service decoration he earned and was entitled to receive.

Mr. Stein served our nation in uniform for 33 years, serving in the U.S. Army and retiring in the U.S. Army Reserves. Some of his tours include service in World War II, Korea, and Vietnam. In WWII, Mr. Stein was a Prisoner of War in Germany and was liberated in 1945.

One of the most rewarding responsibilities of being your member of Congress is serving our veterans and advocating on their behalf.
